net.cloud.server.entity.player

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.cloud.server.entity.Entity
      • net.cloud.server.entity.player.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Bufferable

    public class Player
extends Entity
implements Bufferable
    The Player object. Home of the player. Holds the player's data. Keeps the player's data safe. A hub for all of the player's information. The root of the save data. Yes.

    • Field Summary

      Fields

      The object holding information on our connection

      • Player

        public Player(PacketSender packetSender,
              PlayerChannelConfig config)
        Constructor that accepts the PacketSender
        Parameters:
        packetSender - PacketSender that will be used throughout lifetime of player
        config - Object holding channel initialization info

    • Method Detail

      • logout

        public void logout()
        Request that this player be logged out from the game

      • onDisconnect

        public void onDisconnect()
        Tell the player that it was disconnect abruptly. May take whatever action necessary when a disconnect happens, as is relevant to this player

      • onReconnectFailed

        public void onReconnectFailed()
        Tell the player that after disconnecting, they did not reconnect in time. May take whatever action necessary for when this happens, as is relevant to this player

      • finishedLoading

        public void finishedLoading()
        Tell this player that its data has been loaded and it's time for it to be able to save data

      • getUsername

        public String getUsername()
        Returns:
        The player's username

        Parameters:
        username - the username to set

      • getPassword

        Returns:
        The player's password

      • setPassword

        public void setPassword(String password)
        Parameters:
        password - the password to set

      • getLoginState

        public LoginState getLoginState()
        Returns:
        The LoginState for this player. Ie, which step of login process they are in

      • setLoginState

        public void setLoginState(LoginState loginState)
        Parameters:
        loginState - Which step of the login process the player is now in

      • getChannelConfig

        public PlayerChannelConfig getChannelConfig()
        The object that holds information about our connection
        Returns:
        The channelConfig

      • setChannelConfig

        public void setChannelConfig(PlayerChannelConfig config)
        Parameters:
        config - A new configuration object

      • getPacketSender

        public PacketSender getPacketSender()
        Get the PacketSender the server uses to communicate with the player
        Returns:
        The PacketSender allowing communication to the player

      • setPacketSender

        public void setPacketSender(PacketSender packetSender)
        Assign a packet sender to this player. Useful for when their connection changes
        Parameters:
        packetSender - The new packet sender

      • getLastLogin

        public ConnectionInfo getLastLogin()
        Returns:
        When the player was last logged in. null if they never have been.

      • updateLastLogin

        public void updateLastLogin()
        Sets this player's last login information to their status here and now. Does require that they be logged into the game.

      • saveToFile

        public void saveToFile()
                throws PlayerSaveException
        Save this player's data to file. Serializing data is done on the calling thread, writing to the file is done on the File Server.
        Throws:
        PlayerSaveException - If the data could not be saved. Not thrown if file could not be written.

      • save

        public void save(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Save all of the non-transient player data to the buffer
        Specified by:
        save in interface Bufferable
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to place all necessary data into

      • restore

        public void restore(io.netty.buffer.ByteBuf buffer)
        Restore all of the non-transient player data from the buffer
        Specified by:
        restore in interface Bufferable
        Parameters:
        buffer - The buffer to read all necessary data from

      • restoreUserAndPass

        public void restoreUserAndPass(RandomAccessFile raf)
                        throws IOException
        Restore only the username and password from the player save file. This assumes the file has just been opened, and the pointer is at the beginning of the file. After this method returns, only the username and password fields will have been set.
        Parameters:
        raf - The file to read the username and password from
        Throws:
        IOException - If the file could not be read from
